intro: Phlomoides tatsienensis, commonly known as the Tatsienlou phlomoides, is a flowering plant native to China. It belongs to the family Lamiaceae, which includes many aromatic herbs and shrubs. The plant is characterized by its slender stems and small, lance-shaped leaves. It produces clusters of pale blue to violet flowers, which bloom in late summer. This species is often found in rocky or mountainous regions, where it thrives in well-drained soils.
